data.text: Schon aus Prinzip verstelle ich mich nicht. Wenn ich auf der Bühne bin, bin ich Jan und vertrete auch meine Ansichten. Wobei es mir ganz wichtig ist, dass es bei meinen Konzerten um Spaß und Gaming geht. Alle anderen polarisierenden politischen oder Alltagsthemen halte ich aus gutem Grund aus meinen Auftritten heraus. Denn ich bin davon überzeugt, dass Jan Hegenberg Konzerte für einen Moment im Leben stehen, in dem man sich eben mal keine Sorgen machen muss, in dem man einfach nur das Hier und Jetzt auf sich wirken lässt – Energie, Spaß, Musik. Nach dem Konzert soll man nach Hause gehen und sagen können, „boah, das waren mal super geile Stunden und man hat über nichts anderes nachgedacht“.
data.translation: I never pretend, even as a principle. When I'm on stage, I am Jan, and I express my opinions. However, it's crucial to me that my concerts are about fun and gaming. I purposefully exclude all divisive political topics or everyday issues from my performances, and for good reason. I firmly believe that Jan Hegenberg concerts represent moments in life where you shouldn't have to worry, where you can just let the here and now take effect - energy, fun, music. After the concert, you should be able to go home and say, "wow, those were some awesome hours, and I didn't think about anything else."

data.translation: I stay true to myself as a matter of principle. When I'm on stage, I am simply Jan, sharing my own perspectives. Importantly, my concerts focus on fun and gaming. I intentionally steer clear of divisive political or everyday subjects in my performances, and for good reason. I firmly believe that Jan Hegenberg concerts should provide a break from life’s worries, allowing everyone to soak up the present moment – all about energy, fun, and music. After the show, you should be able to head home and think, "Wow, those were some fantastic hours where I just let go and thought of nothing else."

data.translation: Out of principle, I do not pretend to be someone else. When I step onto the stage, I am Jan, authentically representing my views. It is paramount to me that my concerts revolve around enjoyment and gaming. I purposely avoid delving into other divisive political or mundane topics during my performances for a specific reason. I firmly believe that Jan Hegenberg concerts offer a moment in life where one can momentarily shed their worries and simply bask in the present – filled with energy, amusement, and music. Following the concert, one should be able to return home and exclaim, "Those were incredibly awesome hours where nothing else occupied my mind."

data.text: Dort war eine sehr alte Frau, die kein Wort mehr sprach. Nennen wir sie Frau Schulze. Sie saß da und schwieg. Ich sollte ihr Essen bringen und sie füttern. Eines Tages waren Weintrauben dabei. Ich saß vor ihr, nahm eine Weintraube, zog mit den Zähnen die Haut ab, nahm den Kern heraus und gab ihr ein Stückchen mit der Hand in ihren Mund. Ihre Augen strahlten. Ein glückliches Lächeln verzauberte ihr Gesicht. Ich nahm die nächste Weintraube, zog mit den Zahnen wieder die Haut ab, nahm die Kerne raus und schob es ihr in den Mund. So ging das die ganze Zeit und sie lächelte, strahlte und ihre Augen sahen mich an, als wäre ich ein Engel.
data.translation: There was an extremely old woman there who no longer spoke. Let's call her Frau Schulze. She sat there and remained silent. I was supposed to bring her food and feed her. One day there were grapes. I sat in front of her, took a grape, bit off the skin with my teeth, took out the seeds, and gave her a piece in her hand. Her eyes lit up. A happy smile lit up her face. I took the next grape, bit off the skin with my teeth, took out the seeds, and pushed it into her mouth with my hand. That went on all the time and she smiled, glowed, and looked at me as if I were an angel.

data.translation: In the room was a very old woman who had become mute. We'll call her Mrs. Schulze. She sat quietly, emanating a profound silence. My task was to deliver and feed her meals. On one particular day, grapes were on the menu. I sat before her, carefully peeled a grape with my teeth, extracted the seed, and tenderly placed a segment into her mouth with my hand. Her eyes lit up. A joyful smile transformed her face. Continuing, I prepared another grape the same way, peeled and seeded, then gently fed it to her. Our entire time was spent in this gentle rhythm, her smile wide, her gaze upon me full of gratitude, as though she saw me as an angel.

data.text: Prinzip Nummer VIER: LANGSAMKEIT Beim Gleiten wirst Du gemerkt haben, wie schnell dir die Obertöne wieder entgleiten, kaum dass sie kurz zu hören gewesen sind. Um die Obertöne steuern zu können, brauchst es nun einen wirklich guten Kontakt zu den einzelnen Obertönen. Das lässt sich realisieren über die Verlangsamung des Gleitens. Gleite von einem Vokal zum anderen so langsam wie möglich, quasi in Zeitlupe, um den Übergang von einem Oberton zum nächsten so klar wie möglich zu erfassen und körperlich zu begreifen. Dieses super langsame Gleiten kannst Du auch mit deiner normalen Stimme üben und dann auf die Verwandlung der Vokale übertragen. Je langsamer du durch das Klangfeld deiner Stimme gleitest, umso mehr Obertöne wirst du klar und deutlich unterscheiden können.
data.translation: You will notice, while gliding, how quickly the overtones slip away, barely heard. To control the overtones, a real good contact with each individual overtone is now required. This can be achieved through the slowing down of gliding. Glide from one vowel to another as slowly as possible, almost in slow motion, to clearly perceive and understand the transition from one overtone to the next. This extremely slow gliding can also be practiced with your normal voice and then applied to the transformation of vowels. The slower you glide through the sound field of your voice, the more clearly and distinctly you will be able to differentiate the overtones.

In order to be able to steer the upper tones, you now need a really good connection to the individual upper tones. This can be realized by slowing down the gliding process. This super slow gliding can also be practiced with your normal voice and then transferred to the transformation of the vowels. The slower you glide through the sound field of your voice, the more upper tones you will be able to clearly and distinctly distinguish.

data.translation: Principle number FOUR: SLOWNESS As you glide, you may have noticed how quickly the overtones slip away from you, almost as soon as they have been briefly audible. To be able to control the overtones, it is essential to develop a strong connection with each individual overtone. This can be achieved by slowing down the gliding process. Glide from one vowel to another as slowly as possible, almost in slow motion, in order to clearly grasp and physically feel the transition from one overtone to the next. The slower you glide through the acoustic field of your voice, the more clearly and distinctly you will be able to differentiate the overtones.

data.translation:
Principle Number FOUR: SLOWNESS
While gliding, you may have noticed how quickly the overtones slip away, barely being heard for a moment. In order to control the overtones, you now need a really good connection to each individual overtone. This can be achieved by slowing down the gliding. Glide from one vowel to another as slowly as possible, almost in slow motion, in order to grasp and physically understand the transition from one overtone to the next as clearly as possible. You can practice this super slow gliding with your normal voice and then apply it to the transformation of vowels. The slower you glide through the sound field of your voice, the more overtones you will be able to clearly and distinctly distinguish.

Gleite von einem Vokal zum anderen so langsam wie möglich, quasi in Zeitlupe, um den Übergang von einem Oberton zum nächsten so klar wie möglich zu erfassen und körperlich zu begreifen. data.translation: Principle Number FOUR: SLOWNESS While you're gliding, you might have observed how swiftly the overtones escape your grasp, barely perceptible for a short time. In order to manage the overtones, it's essential to establish a solid connection with each individual overtone. This can be achieved by decelerating your glide. Transition from one vowel to another as slowly as possible, essentially in slow motion, to clearly capture and physically comprehend the shift from one overtone to the next. You can also practice this super slow glide using your normal voice, applying this technique to vowel transformation subsequently. The slower you glide through your voice's sound field, the more distinctly and clearly will you be able to discern the overtones.

value.text: It was work, but this was a special occasion.
and I envisioned a table around which his family sits,

data.text: Weihnachten stand vor der Tür, und mein Ex und ich verbrachten Weihnachten immer bei meiner Familie. Er hatte sich nie darum gekümmert, sich mit seiner Familie an Feiertagen zu treffen. Aber er fragte mich, ob es mir etwas ausmachen würde, seinen Bruder und seine Schwester am Heiligabend zum Essen einzuladen. Ich sagte, dass ich ein tolles Essen machen würde. Ich bin kein schlechter Koch, und ich stellte mir einen Tisch vor, um den herum seine Familie sitzt, lacht und redet und das Essen genießt, das ich zubereitet habe. Also habe ich ein sehr schönes Essen zubereitet, einschließlich eines spiralförmig geschnittenen Schinkens mit allem Drum und Dran. Es war Arbeit, aber dies war ein besonderer Anlass.
data.translation: Christmas was approaching, and my ex and I always spent Christmas with my family. He had never bothered to meet with his family during the holidays. But he asked me if I would mind inviting his brother and sister over for dinner on Christmas Eve. I said that I would make a great meal. I'm not a bad cook, and I envisioned a table around which his family sits, laughing and talking and enjoying the food I prepared. So, I prepared a very nice meal, including a spiral-sliced ham with all the trimmings. It was work, but this was a special occasion.

He never really made an effort to connect with his own family during the holidays. However, this year he suggested we invite his brother and sister to join us for dinner on Christmas Eve. I agreed, promising to whip up a fantastic meal. I consider myself quite a decent cook, and I imagined a scene with his family gathered around the table, enjoying lively conversation and savoring the meal I'd prepared. With that vision in mind, I put together an exquisite dinner, featuring a spiral-cut ham with all the fixings. It required effort, but it was indeed a special occasion.

data.text: "Plinius führt weiter aus, dass Kleopatra dies amüsant fand und beschloss, sich auf seine Kosten zu amüsieren. Deshalb trug sie bei einem Bankett auf ihrem Kopf einen Blumenkranz, dessen Extremitäten in Gift getaucht waren. Im Laufe des Festes wurde die Atmosphäre immer fröhlicher, und Kleopatra forderte ihren Geliebten auf, die Blumen zu schlucken, indem er sie mit Wein vermischte. Marcus Antonius konnte sich der Herausforderung nicht widersetzen und trank fast den vergifteten Wein, als die Königin ihm Einhalt gebot. Dann rief sie seinen Vorkoster herbei, der nach dem Trinken des Weins natürlich tot umfiel. So zeigte Kleopatra Marcus Antonius, dass die beste Vorsichtsmaßnahme, die er gegen eine Vergiftung hatte, darin bestand, ihr zu vertrauen.
data.translation: Pliny continues by stating that Cleopatra found this amusing and decided to entertain herself at his expense. Therefore, during a banquet, she wore a wreath on her head, the ends of which were dipped in poison. As the party progressed, the atmosphere became increasingly jovial, and Cleopatra challenged her lover to drink the poisoned flowers, mixing them with wine. Marcus Antonius could not resist the challenge and almost drank the poisoned wine, but the queen stopped him. Then she called for her steward, who, after drinking the wine, of course, fell dead. In this way, Cleopatra showed Marcus Antonius that the best precaution he could take against poisoning was to trust her.

data.translation: Pliny goes on to describe how Cleopatra was amused by this and decided to make a sport of it at his expense. At a banquet, she wore a floral wreath with tips dipped in poison. As the evening's merriments amplified, Cleopatra playfully dared her lover to consume the flowers by blending them with his wine. Marcus Antonius could not refuse the dare and nearly consumed the poisoned wine before the queen intervened. Subsequently, she called over his food taster, who tragically collapsed and died after sipping the wine. This dramatic episode served to demonstrate to Marcus Antonius that his best defense against poison was simply to trust her.

data.text: Es gibt viele perfekte Szenen, wie die oben beschriebene. Eine andere ist die Szene, nachdem Lois Superman auf ihrem Balkon interviewt hat. Superman fliegt weg und kehrt dann als Clark Kent an ihre Tür zurück. Er kommt herein und ist völlig verkleidet. Er trägt die Brille. Er geht gebückt. Seine Stimme ist höher. Seine Präsenz ist kleiner. Er ist nervös. Es gibt einen Moment, in dem er darüber nachdenkt, Lois zu sagen, wer er wirklich ist. Wir sehen, wie er in den Spiegel schaut, seine Brille abnimmt, und dann verändert sich seine gesamte Körpersprache. Er verwandelt sich von dem nebulösen Clark in Superman, indem er einfach seine Haltung und seinen Gesichtsausdruck ändert.
data.translation: There are many perfect scenes like the one described above. Another is the scene after Lois has interviewed Superman on her balcony. Superman flies away and then returns to her door as Clark Kent. He enters, fully disguised. He wears glasses. He stoops. His voice is higher. His presence is smaller. He is nervous. There is a moment when he considers telling Lois who he really is. We see him looking into the mirror, taking off his glasses, and then his entire body language changes. He transforms from the nebulous Clark into Superman simply by altering his posture and facial expression.

data.translation: There are numerous flawless scenes, such as the one described earlier. Another noteworthy scene is the one following Lois's interview with Superman on her balcony. After Superman flies off and subsequently returns to her door in the guise of Clark Kent, he enters appearing entirely transformed. Adorned with his glasses, he shuffles in, adopting a meeker demeanor with a higher-pitched voice, exuding a diminished presence, and displaying visible nervousness. At a pivotal moment, he contemplates revealing his true identity to Lois. We witness him gazing into the mirror, removing his glasses, and witnessing a complete shift in his body language. The enigmatic Clark transitions into Superman simply by adjusting his stance and facial expression.

data.translation: There are many perfect scenes, such as the one previously described. Another standout moment occurs after Lois interviews Superman on her balcony. Following the interview, Superman flies off only to return shortly after as Clark Kent at her door. He enters in full disguise, glasses on, shoulders hunched, his voice elevated, and his overall presence diminished. He's visibly nervous. At one point, he contemplates revealing his true identity to Lois. As we watch him peer into the mirror and remove his glasses, his entire demeanor transforms. In an instant, the uncertain Clark becomes Superman, altering nothing but his posture and facial expression.

value.text: Born actors often feel the need to step out of themselves.
To change habits. To follow impulses. To try on new wardrobes. To mimic the behavior patterns of other people... All these are essential tools for the acting profession,
The "narcissistic personality disorder" is, so to speak

data.text: Was eben auch an Stars gefeiert wird, ist deren Ausdrucksfreiheit Rollen zu wechseln. Die meisten von uns sind in den Konstrukten der jeweiligen Lebensumstände gefangen. Die geborenen Schauspieler haben oft das Bedürfniss aus sich heraus zu gehen. Gewohnheiten zu verändern. Impulsen zu folgen. Neue Garderobe auszuprobieren. Verhaltensmuster anderer Menschen nachzuahmen… Alles wichtige Werkzeuge für den Schauspielberuf, aber unvereinbar mit einem geregeltem Leben. Ein Schauspieler muss sich mit vielen Facetten seines Selbst befassen. Das zerstört Bindungen, was sie zu komplexen Lebenspartnern macht. Die "narzisstische Persönlichkeitsstörung" ist sozusagen die Eintrittskarte in die Welt des Schauspiels. Doch es ist auch dieselbe Branche, welche den notwendigen Hochmut durch Unbeständigkeit, Ausbeutung und Missbrauch bestraft. Daran zerbrechen die Meisten.
data.translation: What is also celebrated about stars is their freedom to switch roles. Most of us are trapped in the constructs of our respective life circumstances. Born actors often feel the need to step out of themselves. To change habits. To follow impulses. To try on new wardrobes. To mimic the behavior patterns of other people... All these are essential tools for the acting profession, but incompatible with a regulated life. An actor must deal with many facets of their self. data.text: Aber die Beatles - das war etwas ganz Neues, Einzigartiges damals. Die Vier waren so schön. John war mein persönlicher Favorit, er hatte eine tolle Stimme. Paul mit seinen großen Augen und dem Kussmund war ein absoluter Mädchentraum. Auch George war nicht ohne … die drei standen vorne, meistens schön gekleidet, noch sehr "brav" im Gegensatz zu den heutigen Rockstars … alle 1,80 m hoch, schlank, langbeinig und attraktiv. Nur Ringo saß halt hinten am Schlagzeug - ich würde ihn nicht gerade attraktiv nennen (Ringo-Fans, vergebt mir bitte !) aber er war sympathisch und fröhlich. Obwohl nur nach aussen hin … er hatte ständig Gesundheitsprobleme damals, ich glaube, es war ein Magenleiden.
data.translation: But the Beatles - that was something completely new and unique back then. The four of them were so beautiful. John was my personal favourite, he had a great voice. Paul with his big eyes and pout was a complete dream for girls. And George was not without... the three of them stood at the front, usually nicely dressed, and were very "proper" compared to the rock stars of today... all 1.80 m tall, slim, long-legged and attractive. Only Ringo sat at the back of the drum kit - I wouldn't call him particularly attractive (Ringo fans, please forgive me!) but he was likeable and cheerful, although only on the outside... he had constant health problems at the time, I think it was a stomach ailment.

data.translation: But the Beatles – they were a true revelation at the time, completely unique and groundbreaking. Each of the four was so handsome. John was my personal favorite; his voice was fantastic. Paul, with his big eyes and kissable lips, was every girl's dream. George was impressive too… the three of them often at the forefront, impeccably dressed, still quite "prim and proper" compared to today's rock stars… all standing around 5'11", slender, long-legged, and striking. Ringo, on the other hand, was always at the back on the drums – I wouldn't necessarily call him handsome (apologies to any Ringo fans!), but he was affable and cheerful. Although, that was only on the surface… he was constantly dealing with health issues back then, I think it was a stomach condition.

Paul mit seinen großen Augen und dem Kussmund war ein absoluter Mädchentraum. Auch George war nicht ohne … die drei standen vorne, meistens schön gekleidet, noch sehr "brav" im Gegensatz zu den heutigen Rockstars … alle 1,80 m hoch, schlank, langbeinig und attraktiv. Nur Ringo saß halt hinten am Schlagzeug - ich würde ihn nicht gerade attraktiv nennen (Ringo-Fans, vergebt mir bitte !) aber er war sympathisch und fröhlich. Obwohl nur nach aussen hin … er hatte ständig Gesundheitsprobleme damals, ich glaube, es war ein Magenleiden.
data.translation: But the Beatles - that was something completely new, unique back then. The four of them were so beautiful. John was my personal favorite; he had a great voice. Paul with his big eyes and pouty lips was an absolute dream for girls. George was no slouch either… the three of them stood at the front, usually dressed nicely, still very "proper" compared to today's rock stars… all 1.80 meters tall, slim, long-legged, and attractive. Only Ringo was sitting at the back on the drums - I wouldn’t exactly call him attractive (sorry, Ringo fans!), but he was likable and cheerful. Though just outwardly… he constantly had health issues back then, I believe it was a stomach ailment.

data.text: Wir waren in einem Restaurant, es war okay, aber der Service war nicht besonders gut. Das Essen wurde immer in die Mitte gestellt, so dass immer mehrere Leute von verschiedenen Tellern die verschiedenen Gerichte essen konnten. Es war lecker, aber definitiv für die Menge an Menschen, die wir waren, viel zu wenig (eine ziemliche Menge von den Kollegen ist anschließend noch zu McD gegangen) dazu kam ein großer Teil eiskalt. Und die zwei Kellner haben sich auf gar keinen Fall überschlagen, weder was die Eile noch was die Freundlichkeit betrifft. Außerdem hätten es gut und gerne noch zwei weitere Kellner sein können, aber wir wissen ja alle, dass so viele Restaurants momentan unter Personalmangel leiden.
data.translation: We went to a restaurant; it was okay, but the service left much to be desired. The food was always placed in the center so that many people could share various dishes from different plates. It was tasty, but definitely not enough for the number of us (quite a few of my colleagues ended up going to McDonald's afterward), plus a significant portion was ice-cold. The two waiters were in no way exceptional, neither in terms of promptness nor politeness. Moreover, the place could have easily used two more waiters, but we all know that many restaurants are currently suffering from a staff shortage.

data.translation: We visited a restaurant; it was alright, but the service left much to be desired. The food was always served family-style in the center of the table, allowing various people to share multiple dishes. While the flavors were good, the quantity was insufficient for our large group—so much so that several colleagues ended up going to McDonald's afterwards. Moreover, a significant portion of the meal was served cold. The two waiters on duty certainly didn't go the extra mile, lacking both promptness and cordiality. Additionally, the staffing could have easily accommodated two more waiters, but as we all know, many restaurants are presently grappling with staff shortages.

data.text: Das Gericht, der British Columbia Supreme Court, hat die Klage aus verfahrenstechnischen Gründen abgewiesen (2019 BCSC 1580 Mann v. Ball). Nach kanadischem Recht muss dann der Kläger die Gerichtskosten bestreiten - es erging jedoch in keinster Weise ein Urteil, lediglich der oben zitierte Einstellungsbeschluss. Ein Einstellungsgrund für das Gericht war laut diesem Beschluss neben Verzögerungen durch den Anwalt Manns, dass die drei Leumundszeugen, die Ball benannt hatte, zwischenzeitlich verstorben waren, sowie die Eingabe Timothy Ball's, worin sein Anwalt sein Alter, seinen Gesundheitszustand sowie, nach Auskunft des Anwalts von M.E. Mann, seine geringe Glaubwürdigkeit und wissenschaftliche Bedeutungslosigkeit (in einem anderen Prozess war Ball bereits aktenkundig mit dieser dummen Ausrede durchgekommen) geltend machte.
data.translation: The British Columbia Supreme Court dismissed the case on procedural grounds (2019 BCSC 1580 Mann v. Ball). Under Canadian law, the plaintiff is then responsible for covering the court costs, yet no judgment was rendered, merely the cited dismissal order. According to the order, reasons for dismissal included delays by Mann's attorney, the death of the three character witnesses Ball had named, and submissions from Ball's lawyer highlighting his age, health condition, and purported low credibility and lack of scientific relevance—as previously touted by M.E. Mann's attorney in another case where Ball had used this same questionable defense successfully.

data.translation: The British Columbia Supreme Court dismissed the claim for procedural reasons (2019 BCSC 1580 Mann v. Ball), and the plaintiff had to bear the court costs under Canadian law. However, no judgment was issued; instead, the above-mentioned dismissal order was issued. One of the grounds for the court's dismissal was that the three character witnesses Ball had named were deceased in the meantime, and that Timothy Ball had filed an application in which he claimed that his lawyer's age, health condition, and his scientific insignificance and lack of credibility (in another case, Ball was already known to the court due to his ridiculous claim that he was too old to participate in the proceedings) were so poor that he could not participate in the proceedings.

Nach kanadischem Recht muss dann der Kläger die Gerichtskosten bestreiten - es erging jedoch in keinster Weise ein Urteil, lediglich der oben zitierte Einstellungsbeschluss. Ein Einstellungsgrund für das Gericht war laut diesem Beschluss neben Verzögerungen durch den Anwalt Manns, dass die drei Leumundszeugen, die Ball benannt hatte, zwischenzeitlich verstorben waren, sowie die Eingabe Timothy Ball's, worin sein Anwalt sein Alter, seinen Gesundheitszustand sowie, nach Auskunft des Anwalts von M.E. Mann, seine geringe Glaubwürdigkeit und wissenschaftliche Bedeutungslosigkeit (in einem anderen Prozess war Ball bereits aktenkundig mit dieser dummen Ausrede durchgekommen) geltend machte.
data.translation: The court, the British Columbia Supreme Connecticut, dismissed the case on procedural grounds (2019 BCSC 1580 Mann v. Ball). According to Canadian law, the plaintiff then must bear the court costs - however, no judgment was issued in any form, just the dismissal order cited above. Reasons for dismissal by the court, according to this order, included delays caused by Mann's lawyer, as well as the death of the three character witnesses whom Ball had named in the meantime, and the submission by Timothy Ball's lawyer citing his age, his health condition, and his low credibility and scientific insignificance (in another case, Ball had already gotten away with this foolish excuse) as argued by M.E. Mann's lawyer.

data.text: Zwar sind normale Holster die weitaus bessere Wahl, allerdings würde das darauf schließen lassen, dass das öffentliche Tragen einer Waffe legal ist. In den meisten Ländern ist dies nicht der Fall, so dass jeder, der eine Waffe trägt, ein Krimineller wäre. Wenn ein Polizist gesehen wurde, kann eine in den Hosenbund gesteckte Waffe einfach weggeworfen werden. Wenn diese Waffe in einem Holster steckte und der Polizist den Verdächtigen durchsucht und die Waffe entdeckt hat, gibt es keinen guten Grund, warum er einen Holster tragen sollte. Während also ein erhöhtes Risiko besteht, dass die Waffe abrutscht oder herunterfällt, ist das Risiko einer siebenjährigen Haftstrafe (im Vereinigten Königreich nur aufgrund des alleinigen Besitzes) größer.
data.translation: Although normal holsters are by far the better choice, having one would imply that carrying a weapon in public is legal. In most countries, this is not the case, so anyone carrying a weapon would be considered a criminal. If a police officer was seen, a weapon tucked into the waistband could simply be discarded. If this weapon were in a holster and the officer searched the suspect and found the weapon, there's no good reason why he should be wearing a holster. Thus, while there is an increased risk that the weapon might slip or fall out, the risk of a seven-year prison sentence (in the United Kingdom, just for possession alone) is greater.

data.translation: Regular holsters are indeed the superior choice, but opting for them could mistakenly imply that public carrying of a weapon is permissible. In most countries, however, this is not the case, meaning that anyone carrying a weapon would be deemed a criminal. In the event a police officer is spotted, a weapon discretely tucked into the waistband can be easily disposed of. In contrast, if the weapon is holstered and the officer conducts a search uncovering the weapon, there is no valid justification for the suspect to be equipped with a holster. Therefore, while there is a heightened risk of the weapon slipping or falling, the potential consequence of facing a seven-year prison term (in the United Kingdom, solely for possession) outweighs this risk.

data.text: Zwar sind normale Holster die weitaus bessere Wahl, allerdings würde das darauf schließen lassen, dass das öffentliche Tragen einer Waffe legal ist. In den meisten Ländern ist dies nicht der Fall, so dass jeder, der eine Waffe trägt, ein Krimineller wäre. Wenn ein Polizist gesehen wurde, kann eine in den Hosenbund gesteckte Waffe einfach weggeworfen werden. Wenn diese Waffe in einem Holster steckte und der Polizist den Verdächtigen durchsucht und die Waffe entdeckt hat, gibt es keinen guten Grund, warum er einen Holster tragen sollte. Während also ein erhöhtes Risiko besteht, dass die Waffe abrutscht oder herunterfällt, ist das Risiko einer siebenjährigen Haftstrafe (im Vereinigten Königreich nur aufgrund des alleinigen Besitzes) größer.
data.translation: Although regular holsters are the much better choice, this would imply that carrying a firearm in public is legal. In most countries, this is not the case, so anyone carrying a firearm would be a criminal. If a police officer sees a weapon tucked into the belt, it can simply be discarded. If the weapon is in a holster and the officer searches the suspect and discovers the weapon, there is no good reason for the suspect to wear a holster, as there is a greater risk that the weapon will slip or fall out. While there is a higher risk that the weapon will slide or fall out, the risk of a seven-year prison sentence (in the United Kingdom, only for possession alone) is greater.

data.text: Es machte mir überhaupt nichts aus, bei dem zu bleiben, was die Session-Musiker auf der Platte machten. Verdammt, ich war einer von ihnen. Als ich mit der Band Roxette durch Kanada und die USA tourte, wusste ich, dass das Schlagzeug in Roxettes Musik eine große Rolle spielte, und viele Leute kannten diese Füllungen. Songs wie The Look hatten bestimmte erkennbare Trommelfüllungen, und sie mussten genau wie die Aufnahmen gemacht werden. Marie Fredriksson von Roxette wurde eine gute Freundin von mir. Ich sagte ihr einmal, dass ich ihre Stimme liebte, sie hatte etwas Mädchenhaftes, aber gleichzeitig auch sexy. Dafür bekam ich eine Umarmung. Ruhe in Frieden Marie, die Welt vermisst dich.
data.translation: I didn't mind at all sticking to what the session musicians did on the record. Hell, I was one of them. When I toured Canada and the USA with the band Roxette, I knew that drums played a big role in Roxette's music, and many people recognized those fills. Songs like The Look had specific, recognizable drum fills, and they had to be performed exactly as on the recordings. Marie Fredriksson from Roxette became a good friend of mine. I once told her that I loved her voice, which had something girlish yet at the same time sexy. I got a hug for that. Rest in peace, Marie. The world misses you.

data.text: Danny Boyle enthüllte damals, dass die Königin sich tatsächlich freiwillig bereit erklärte, ihre eigene Rolle in seiner Eröffnungszeremonie zu spielen, die eine Parodie auf 007 war. Boyle selbst war nicht so frech, die Königin zu bitten, die Rolle zu spielen, da er zunächst eine Doppelgängerin ins Auge gefasst hatte. Anscheinend, gingen sie das übliche Protokoll durch, brachten den Sketch durch die richtigen Kanäle und baten den Palast um die Erlaubnis, diesen Aufenthaltsort zu nutzen, und baten vielleicht eine Schauspielerin wie Helen Mirren, die Rolle zu spielen. Sie waren absolut sprachlos, als die Antwort zurückkam, dass sie nicht nur die Erlaubnis hätten, sondern dass die Königin selbst die Rolle gerne spielen würde.
data.translation: Danny Boyle disclosed at the time that the Queen had actually volunteered to play her own role in his opening ceremony, which was a parody of the 007 franchise. Boyle himself hesitated to directly approach the Queen for the role, initially considering using a lookalike. Apparently, they followed standard protocol, submitted the sketch through official channels, and sought permission from the Palace to use the venue, possibly approaching an actress like Helen Mirren to portray the role. They were left utterly speechless when the response arrived, not only granting permission, but expressing the Queen's personal willingness to take on the role.

data.translation: Danny Boyle revealed that the Queen had actually volunteered to play her own role in his opening ceremony, which was a parody of 007. Boyle himself was not bold enough to ask the Queen to take on the role, as he initially considered using a double. Apparently, they followed the usual protocol, pushing the sketch through the proper channels and asking the palace for permission to use the location, and even considered asking an actress like Helen Mirren to play the role. They were absolutely speechless when the response came back that not only did they have permission, but the Queen herself was eager to play the role.

data.text: Danny Boyle enthüllte damals, dass die Königin sich tatsächlich freiwillig bereit erklärte, ihre eigene Rolle in seiner Eröffnungszeremonie zu spielen, die eine Parodie auf 007 war. Boyle selbst war nicht so frech, die Königin zu bitten, die Rolle zu spielen, da er zunächst eine Doppelgängerin ins Auge gefasst hatte. Anscheinend, gingen sie das übliche Protokoll durch, brachten den Sketch durch die richtigen Kanäle und baten den Palast um die Erlaubnis, diesen Aufenthaltsort zu nutzen, und baten vielleicht eine Schauspielerin wie Helen Mirren, die Rolle zu spielen. Sie waren absolut sprachlos, als die Antwort zurückkam, dass sie nicht nur die Erlaubnis hätten, sondern dass die Königin selbst die Rolle gerne spielen würde.
data.translation: Danny Boyle revealed back then that the Queen actually volunteered to play her own role in his opening ceremony, which was a parody of 007. Boyle himself was not so bold as to ask the Queen to play the role, as he had first considered hiring a double. Apparently, they went through the usual protocol, bringing the sketch through the proper channels and asking the palace for permission to use this location, and perhaps even asking an actress like Helen Mirren to play the role. They were completely speechless when the response came back that not only did they have permission, but that the Queen herself would be happy to play the role.

data.text: Gemäß dieser Einteilung ist orchestrale Filmmusik als populäre Musik zu bezeichnen, was auch ihrer Zielgruppe entspricht: Der Allgemeinheit. Auch die Verwendung als Hintergrundmusik, als Untermalung, nicht als eigenständig zu hörende Musik macht sie typischer populärer Musik viel ähnlicher als typischer akademischer. Nur eine Minderheit spezialisierter Liebhaber konsumiert diese Art von Musik unabhängig vom Film; sie wird nur selten live aufgeführt (z. B. Musik zu Filmen und Serien mit zahlreichen fanatischen Anhängern wie Star Wars, Lord of the Rings oder Game of Thrones, was auch eine neuere Entwicklung zu sein scheint); und Notenblätter mit Filmmusik sieht man nur selten (und wahrscheinlich fast nur im Zusammenhang mit ihrer Aufzeichnung und den erwähnten Liveorchester-Veranstaltungen).
data.translation: According to this classification, orchestral film music is to be considered as popular music, which also corresponds to its target audience: the general public. Also, its use as background music, as accompaniment, rather than as music to be heard independently, makes it much more similar to typical popular music than to typical academic music. Only a minority of specialized enthusiasts consumes this type of music independently of the film; it is rarely performed live (e.g. music for films and series with numerous fervent followers like Star Wars, Lord of the Rings, or Game of Thrones, which also seems to be a more recent development); and sheet music for film music is rarely seen (and probably almost only in the context of its recording and the aforementioned live orchestra events).

data.translation: Based on this classification, orchestral film music is categorized as popular music, aligning with its intended audience: the general public. Its role as background music, meant to enhance rather than to stand alone for direct listening, aligns it more with conventional popular music than with classical academic music. Only a niche group of enthusiasts engages with this music outside of its cinematic context; live performances are infrequent (e.g., scores from films with cult followings like Star Wars, Lord of the Rings, or Game of Thrones, which appears to be a relatively recent trend); and the availability of film music scores is limited (typically associated only with their recording and the aforementioned live orchestra events).

data.text: Viele dieser Menschen stehen jetzt vor dem Nichts. Ein Grossteil der DJs und Klub Eigentümer, Promoter, Bookers und Talent Agenturen werden das kommende Jahr wirtschaftlich nicht überleben. Leider wird es vor allem jene treffen, die wirklich wegen der Musik dabei waren, wegen der Freude an der Performance. Sie verdienten nie grossartig. Sie kamen gut über die Runden, und sie hatten Spass, bis jetzt. Man muss sich das vorstellen, diese Menschen verlieren ihre ganze Existenz und erhalten quasi Berufsverbot. Oft ist Musik machen, Menschen unterhalten, alles was diese Künstler können, sie stehen vor dem Nichts. Club Besucher müssen ihre Samstag Abende neu organisieren, die Künstler und Clubbetreiber ihr Leben.
data.translation: Many of these people are now facing nothing. A large part of DJs, club owners, promoters, bookers, and talent agencies will not survive economically next year. Unfortunately, it will mainly affect those who were really there for the music, for the joy of performance. They never earned great sums. They managed to get through rounds, and they had fun, until now. One must imagine, these people are losing their entire existence and receiving quasi professional ban. Often, making music, entertaining people, everything that these artists can do, they are facing nothing. Club visitors must reorganize their Saturday nights, the artists and club owners their lives.

Unfortunately, those who were truly in it for the love of the music, for the joy of performance, are the ones who will be hit the hardest. They never earned much. They managed to get by, and they had fun, until now. It’s important to realize that these people are losing their entire livelihoods and are essentially being professionally prohibited. Often, making music, entertaining people, is all these artists know how to do, and they are left with nothing. Club-goers will have to reorganize their Saturday evenings, but the artists and club owners will have to reorganize their lives.

data.text: Viele dieser Menschen stehen jetzt vor dem Nichts. Ein Grossteil der DJs und Klub Eigentümer, Promoter, Bookers und Talent Agenturen werden das kommende Jahr wirtschaftlich nicht überleben. Leider wird es vor allem jene treffen, die wirklich wegen der Musik dabei waren, wegen der Freude an der Performance. Sie verdienten nie grossartig. Sie kamen gut über die Runden, und sie hatten Spass, bis jetzt. Man muss sich das vorstellen, diese Menschen verlieren ihre ganze Existenz und erhalten quasi Berufsverbot. Oft ist Musik machen, Menschen unterhalten, alles was diese Künstler können, sie stehen vor dem Nichts. Club Besucher müssen ihre Samstag Abende neu organisieren, die Künstler und Clubbetreiber ihr Leben.
data.translation: Many of these people are now left with nothing. A large number of DJs, club owners, promoters, bookers, and talent agencies won't survive the economic challenges of the coming year. Unfortunately, it's especially those who were truly in it for the music, for the joy of performance, who will be hardest hit. They never made much money. They managed to get by, and they had fun, until now. Imagine this: these people are losing their entire existence and are effectively being banned from their professions. Often, making music and entertaining people is all these artists know; they are left with nothing. Club-goers will have to reorganize their Saturday evenings, while artists and club operators have to reconstruct their lives.

data.text: Wenn Sie zu Ihrer Mahlzeit ein Glas Wein bestellen, kann dies während der kalten Jahreszeit und der Grippe zu Ihren Gunsten wirken. Eine in Vaccine veröffentlichte Studie legt nahe, dass das Trinken von Wein zum Abendessen mehrmals pro Woche die Wirkung von Impfstoffen verbessern kann. Die Forscher gaben 12 Affen-Pocken-Impfstoffen und gaben ihnen dann Zugang zu 4 Prozent Ethanol oder Zuckerwasser mit der gleichen Menge an Kalorien (Kontrollgruppe). Sie verfolgten den Alkoholkonsum der Affen für 14 Monate und impften sie nach den ersten sieben Monaten erneut. Obwohl alle Affen auf den ersten Impfstoff ähnlich reagierten, sahen die gemäßigten Trinker der Testgruppe eine erhöhte Impfreaktion als sowohl die Nichttrinker als auch die Starktrinker nach dem zweiten.
data.translation: If you order a glass of wine with your meal, it can be beneficial during the cold season and flu season. A study published in Vaccine suggests that drinking wine with dinner several times a week can enhance the effectiveness of vaccines. The researchers administered monkeypox vaccines to 12 primates and then gave them access to either 4 percent ethanol or sugar water with the same calorie count (control group). They monitored the alcohol consumption of the monkeys for 14 months and vaccinated them again after the first seven months. Although all the monkeys responded similarly to the first vaccine, the moderate drinkers in the test group showed an increased vaccine response compared to both the nondrinkers and the heavy drinkers after the second vaccination.

data.translation: If you order a glass of wine with your meal, this can be beneficial during the cold season and the flu. A study published in Vaccine suggests that drinking wine at dinner can improve the effect of vaccines several times a week. The researchers gave 12 monkey vaccines for the smallpox virus and then gave them access to 4 percent ethanol or sugar water with the same caloric content (control group). They monitored the alcohol consumption of the monkeys for 14 months and re-vaccinated them after seven months. Although all the monkeys reacted similarly to the first vaccine, the moderate drinkers in the test group showed a higher immune response than both the non-drinkers and the heavy drinkers after the second vaccine.

data.translation: When you choose to have a glass of wine with your meal, it may work to your advantage during the cold and flu season. A study published in Vaccine suggests that consuming wine during dinner multiple times a week can boost the efficacy of vaccines. Researchers administered pox vaccines to 12 monkeys and later provided them with access to 4 percent ethanol or sugar water with an equivalent calorie content (control group). They monitored the monkeys' alcohol intake for 14 months and administered a second round of vaccinations after the initial seven months. While all monkeys showed similar initial responses to the first vaccine, the moderate drinkers in the test group exhibited an enhanced vaccine reaction compared to both non-drinkers and heavy drinkers following the second round.

data.translation: Ordering a glass of wine with your meal might work in your favor during the flu and cold seasons. According to a study published in Vaccine, enjoying wine with dinner on several occasions each week could boost vaccine efficacy. In the study, researchers administered monkeypox vaccines to 12 primates and then allowed them access to either 4 percent ethanol or an equivalent-calorie sugar water (control group). The team monitored the primates' alcohol intake over 14 months, administering a second round of vaccinations after the first seven months. While the initial vaccination elicited a similar response across all groups, moderate drinkers in the experimental group exhibited a stronger immune response after the second vaccination compared to both the non-drinkers and heavy drinkers.

data.translation: If you order a glass of wine with your meal, this can work to your advantage during the cold season and flu season. A study published in Vaccine suggests that drinking wine with dinner multiple times a week can improve the effectiveness of vaccines. The researchers gave 12 monkeys the smallpox vaccine and then gave them access to 4 percent ethanol or sugar water with the same amount of calories (control group). data.text: Wenn der Schauspieler nur eine "Glatzenhaube" trägt, verbringt er vor dem Dreh wahrscheinlich eine Menge Zeit beim Make-Up und muss dann das unbequeme Ding tragen. Der Schauspieler muss also abwägen, ob er sich das antut oder sich lieber gleich eine Glatze rasiert. Wenn man sich den Kopf rasiert, vergehen einem vielleicht andere Rollen. Ein wichtiger Faktor wird sicher sein, wie viele Szenen mit Glatze gedreht werden sollen. Michael Rosenbaum spielte Lex Luthor in Smallville und rasierte sich für ungefähr sieben Jahre den Kopf, um die Rolle zu spielen. Dann verließ er die Serie für drei Staffeln und kehrte in der letzten Episode zurück - dafür trug er dann aber nur eine Glatzenhaube.
data.translation: If the actor only wears a "bald cap", he probably spends a lot of time in makeup before shooting and then has to wear the uncomfortable thing. The actor must therefore consider whether he is willing to endure this or rather shave his head bald. Shaving one's head may make one lose out on other roles. An important factor will surely be how many scenes are supposed to be shot with a bald cap. Michael Rosenbaum played Lex Luthor in Smallville and shaved his head for about seven years to play the role. Then he left the series for three seasons and returned in the last episode - but this time he only wore a bald cap.

value.text: . If someone shaves their head, perhaps other roles might be offered
- but he then only wore a bald cap.

data.translation: If an actor only wears a "bald cap" (which is a prosthetic cap used to create a bald head), he likely spends a lot of time on makeup before filming and then has to wear the uncomfortable prop. Therefore, the actor must weigh whether it's worth it or if they'd rather just shave their head. If someone shaves their head, perhaps other roles might be offered. A significant factor will certainly be how many scenes with a bald head are to be filmed. Michael Rosenbaum played Lex Luthor in Smallville and shaved his head for approximately seven years to play the role. Then he left the series for three seasons and returned in the final episode - but he then only wore a bald cap.

value.text: The actor must therefore weigh up whether to put up with it or shave his head.

The actor must therefore consider whether to endure this or to shave his head instead. Shaving one's head might limit other roles. An important factor will certainly be how many scenes are to be filmed with a bald head. Michael Rosenbaum played Lex Luthor in Smallville and shaved his head for about seven years to play the role. Then he left the series for three seasons and returned for the last episode—for which he then only wore a bald cap.

data.text: Wenn der Schauspieler nur eine "Glatzenhaube" trägt, verbringt er vor dem Dreh wahrscheinlich eine Menge Zeit beim Make-Up und muss dann das unbequeme Ding tragen. Der Schauspieler muss also abwägen, ob er sich das antut oder sich lieber gleich eine Glatze rasiert. Wenn man sich den Kopf rasiert, vergehen einem vielleicht andere Rollen. Ein wichtiger Faktor wird sicher sein, wie viele Szenen mit Glatze gedreht werden sollen. Michael Rosenbaum spielte Lex Luthor in Smallville und rasierte sich für ungefähr sieben Jahre den Kopf, um die Rolle zu spielen. data.translation: If an actor is just wearing a "bald cap," he likely spends a considerable amount of time in makeup before dealing with the discomfort of the cap itself. The actor must thus decide whether to endure this or opt to shave his head instead. However, going bald can limit opportunities for other roles. A key consideration will be the number of scenes requiring a bald appearance. Michael Rosenbaum, who played Lex Luthor in Smallville, shaved his head for about seven years for the role. He then left the show for three seasons and returned for the final episode, during which he opted for a bald cap instead.

data.text: Und es stellt sich heraus, dass sie, unzufrieden mit ihren Stöcken und Steinen, spitze Stöcke schaffen, die schießen und nicht nur treffen können, sondern auch die Haut durchdringen und die Muskeln zerreißen und mit anderen Stöcken und Seilen spielen, die sie noch tödlicher machen. Und als ob das noch nicht genug wäre, nehmen sie kleine Metallsteinchen, die sich mit einer kontrollierten Explosion in einem Rohr selbst antreiben. Man kann die Explosion kaum hören, bevor diese Steine durch die inneren Organe reißen. Und als ob ihre Fähigkeit, stundenlang zu rennen, nicht schon genug wäre, nähern sie sich nun Metallmonstern, die schneller rennen, als du rennen kannst.
data.translation: And it turns out that they, unhappy with their sticks and stones, create sharp sticks that can shoot and not just hit, but also pierce the skin and tear the muscles, and play with other sticks and ropes that make them even more deadly. And as if that's not enough, they take small metal stones that drive themselves with a controlled explosion in a pipe. You can barely hear the explosion before these stones tear through the internal organs. And as if their ability to run for hours wasn't enough, they now approach metal monsters that run faster than you can run.

And if that wasn't sufficient, they utilize small metal pellets that propel themselves using a controlled explosion within a tube. The explosion is barely audible before these pellets rip through internal organs. And as if their endurance in running for hours wasn't adequate, they now confront metal beasts that can run faster than one can imagine.

data.translation: It turns out that, discontent with their rudimentary sticks and stones, they've crafted sharp sticks that not only shoot and strike, but also pierce the skin and rend the muscles, all while experimenting with various sticks and ropes to enhance their lethality. And as if that weren't sufficient, they've harnessed tiny metal pellets that launch themselves through tubes via controlled explosions — explosions so quiet that they're practically unheard before the pellets rip through vital organs. And as if their remarkable endurance wasn’t enough, they now engage with metal beasts that dash faster than any human can.

the society that was completely focused on warfare

data.text: Die Gesellschaften sind sehr ähnlich. Eine Gesellschaft, die von einer einzigen Verhaltensform beherrscht wird, ist nicht von Dauer. Denk an Sparta, den hellenischen Stadtstaat, der seine gesamte Gesellschaft auf Militarisierung ausgerichtet hat, mit einer stark geschichteten Gesellschaft, die auf Schichten von Staatsbürgerschaft und Sklaverei basiert. Während Sparta auf seinem Höhepunkt unglaublich erfolgreich war, weigerte es sich, sich zu verändern und anzupassen, und so wurde es schließlich durch die überlegene Taktik der demokratischen thebanischen Konföderation in der Schlacht von Leuctra gebrochen. So besiegte die Gesellschaft, die mehr Flexibilität und Innovation zuließ, die Gesellschaft, die sich völlig auf die Kriegsführung konzentrierte und von ihrer unflexiblen Überlegenheit überzeugt war.
data.translation: The societies are very similar. A society dominated by a single mode of behavior is not sustainable. Think of Sparta, the Hellenic city-state that based its entire society on militarization, with a highly stratified society based on layers of citizenship and slavery. While Sparta was incredibly successful at its peak, it refused to change and adapt, and so it was eventually defeated by the superior tactics of the democratic Theban confederation in the Battle of Leuctra. Thus, the society that allowed more flexibility and innovation defeated the society that was completely focused on warfare and convinced of its inflexible superiority.
